docs.lead_paragraph: Two health care advocacy groups filed a complaint against CoventryOne, Cigna, Humana and Preferred Medical Plan for what they said was discrimination in Florida.

headline.main: Bias Claims for Insurers in Coverage of H.I.V.
headline.print_headline: Bias Claims for Insurers in Coverage of H.I.V.

docs.abstract: AIDS Institute and National Health Law Program file complaint with Health and Human Services Dept, accusing four insurers of discriminating against people with HIV or AIDS in Florida by requiring them to pay high out-of-pocket costs for drugs; contend that CoventryOne, Cigna, Humana and Preferred Medical Plan have violated provision in health care reform law that prohibits discriminating against consumers because of medical conditions.
docs.snippet: Two health care advocacy groups filed a complaint against CoventryOne, Cigna, Humana and Preferred Medical Plan for what they said was discrimination in Florida.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Two health organizations filed a complaint with federal health officials Thursday alleging some Florida insurance companies are violating the Affordable Care Act by structuring their insurance plans in a way that discourage consumers with HIV and AIDS from choosing those plans.

headline.main: Complaint Accuses 4 Fla Insurers of Discrimination
headline.print_headline: Complaint Accuses 4 Fla Insurers of Discrimination
